availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Nathan Fugate (Breathitt County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier.)

body.p: Breathitt County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Anna Neace Fugate in Breathitt County, Kentucky, in August 1853. Father of Jacob Fugate, John M. E. Fugate, Daniel H. Fugate, Malinda Fugate, and Sarah Fugate. Resident of Breathitt County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Breathitt County in 1860.
[Need Compiled Service Record. Served in the 13th Kentucky Cav (C.S.A.)]

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breathitt County, District 1, p. 31A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breathitt County, District 1, p. 356.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breathitt County, Precinct 3, pp. 408B-409A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994029, Breathitt County Births.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994029, Breathitt County Marriages.
